alert.note: Alert for Laclede; Pulaski (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 5:42AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Laclede and Pulaski Counties through 630 AM CDT... At 542 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northeast of Lebanon, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Northern Fort Leonard Wood... Waynesville... St. Robert... Richland... Dixon... Stoutland... Laquey... Devil`s Elbow... Ozark Springs... Sleeper... Dry Knob... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 131 and 167. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
